newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish central bank sells CDs at new 3.50 pct rate.
newsitem.headline: Danish central bank sells CDs at new 3.50 pct rate.

text.p: Denmark's central bank said on Friday it offered to sell 14-day certificates of deposit (CDs) at a fixed yield of 3.50 percent, down 0.20 point from the previous two-week offer.
The 14-day repo was expected to be automatically cut to the same 3.50 percent at next Thursday's normal repurchase sale day.
The bank earlier announced the 20 basis point cut in the CD rate following rate cuts yesterday in Germany and other European countries.
The bank steers money market rates and liquidity through its 14-day certificates of deposit (CDs) deals and state paper repos.
The central bank discount and key deposit rates were unchanged at 3.25 percent. --Copenhagen newsroom, 45-33-969650
